summary: This is an email from April 23, 2020, summarizing a call with the DOJ Office of the Inspector General (OIG). It discusses the status of the OIG's administrative report on Jeffrey Epstein's death, including the scope of the investigation, identified concerns, and the potential impact of premature disclosure. The email notes that the draft report is not yet complete and contains recommendations for the Bureau of Prisons.

persons.name: Don
persons.context: Mentioned as the person who will call on Tuesday regarding the DOJ-OIG briefing.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the DOJ-OIG administrative report concerning his death in custody. The report identifies administrative concerns related to his treatment.

events.title: Call with DOJ-OIG regarding Epstein report
events.description: A call was held to brief the Inspector General on the status and adjournment of the OIG's administrative report into Jeffrey Epstein's death. The draft report is incomplete and contains recommendations for the BOP.

keyFacts: The DOJ Office of the Inspector General (OIG) is preparing an administrative report on Jeffrey Epstein's death, arising from a prior criminal investigation.
The OIG identified administrative concerns including: failure to provide Epstein a new cellmate, Epstein's use of an unrecorded phone line, and potential problems with the video system.
The OIG report is explicitly NOT investigating failures to conduct counts or rounds, nor is it currently looking into staffing issues.
The draft report is not yet complete and contains recommendations for the Bureau of Prisons (BOP); discussions on these recommendations have not begun.
Premature disclosure of the report's contents could negatively impact the ongoing administrative investigation.
